FluentAccordion.__summary__: The FluentAccordion component allows to toggle the display of content by expanding or collapsing sections.
FluentAccordion.ActiveId: Gets or sets the id of the active accordion item.
FluentAccordion.ActiveIdChanged: Gets or sets a callback when the active id is changed.
FluentAccordion.Block: Gets or sets the width of the focus state
FluentAccordion.ChildContent: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the component.
FluentAccordion.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentAccordion.CollapseItemAsync(String): Collapses the accordion item with the specified id.
FluentAccordion.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentAccordion.ExpandItemAsync(String): Expands the accordion item with the specified id.
FluentAccordion.ExpandMode: Controls the expand mode of the Accordion, either allowingsingle or multiple item expansion. `AccordionExpandMode`.
FluentAccordion.ExpandModeChanged: Gets or sets a callback when the expand mode is changed.
FluentAccordion.HeadingLevel: Gets or sets the [level](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.1/#aria-level) of the heading element.Possible values: 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 | 6
FluentAccordion.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentAccordion.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentAccordion.MarkerPosition: Gets or sets the position of the expand/collapse marker.
FluentAccordion.OnAccordionItemChange: Gets or sets a callback when an accordion item is changed.
FluentAccordion.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentAccordion.Size: Gets or sets the size of the accordion item.
FluentAccordion.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.

FluentAccordionItem.__summary__: Represents an item in a Fluent Accordion component, allowing for customization of its heading, expanded state, and content. It also manages its registration with the owning FluentTreeView and handles state changes.
FluentAccordionItem.Block: Gets or sets the width of the focus state
FluentAccordionItem.ChildContent: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the component.
FluentAccordionItem.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentAccordionItem.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentAccordionItem.Disabled: Gets or sets whether the accordion item is disabled.
FluentAccordionItem.Expanded: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the item is expanded or collapsed.
FluentAccordionItem.ExpandedChanged: Gets or sets a callback for when the expanded state changes.
FluentAccordionItem.Header: Gets or sets the heading of the accordion item.Use either this or the `FluentAccordionItem.HeaderTemplate` parameter."/>If both are set, this parameter will be used.
FluentAccordionItem.HeaderTemplate: Gets or sets the heading content of the accordion item.Use either this or the `FluentAccordionItem.Header` parameter."/>If both are set, this parameter will not be used.
FluentAccordionItem.HeaderTooltip: Gets or sets the heading tooltip of the accordion item.
FluentAccordionItem.HeadingLevel: Gets or sets the [level](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria-1.1/#aria-level) of the heading element.Possible values: 1 | 2 | 3 | 4 | 5 | 6
FluentAccordionItem.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentAccordionItem.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentAccordionItem.MarkerPosition: Gets or sets the position of the expand/collapse marker.
FluentAccordionItem.Owner: Gets or sets the owning FluentTreeView.
FluentAccordionItem.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentAccordionItem.SetExpandedAsync(Boolean): Sets the expanded state of the accordion item.
FluentAccordionItem.Size: Gets or sets the size of the accordion item.
FluentAccordionItem.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.

FluentAvatar.__summary__: The FluentAvatar component is used to represent a user or entity. It can display an image, initials, or an icon.
FluentAvatar.ActiveAppearance: Gets or sets the styled appearance of the avatar when the avatar is "active".
FluentAvatar.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentAvatar.Color: Gets or sets the color of the avatar.
FluentAvatar.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentAvatar.Icon: Gets or sets the default icon. The icon will only be shown when there is no image or initials available.
FluentAvatar.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentAvatar.Image: Gets or sets an avatar can display an image.
FluentAvatar.Initials: Gets or sets custom initials rather than one generated via the name
FluentAvatar.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentAvatar.Name: The name of the person or entity represented by this Avatar. This should always be provided if it is available.The name is used to determine the initials displayed when there is no image.It is also provided to accessibility tools.
FluentAvatar.OnClick: Gets or sets a command executed when the user clicks on the button.
FluentAvatar.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentAvatar.Shape: Gets or sets the shape of the avatar.
FluentAvatar.Size: Gets or sets size of the avatar.
FluentAvatar.Slot: Gets or sets the slot the avatar is displayed in.
FluentAvatar.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.
FluentAvatar.Tooltip: Gets or sets the tooltip text (supports HTML tags).This parameter requires the presence of a 'FluentTooltipProvider' in your main/layout page. _This parameter cannot be updated after the component has been rendered._

FluentBadge.__summary__: The FluentBadge component is a visual indicator that communicates a status or description of an associated component.It uses short text, color, and icons for quick recognition and is placed near the relavant content.
FluentBadge.Appearance: Gets or sets the visual appearance.
FluentBadge.BackgroundColor: Gets or sets the background color.Must be a valid CSS color value.When using BackgroundColor, `FluentBadge.Color` must be explicitly set to null
FluentBadge.ChildContent: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the component.
FluentBadge.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentBadge.Content: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the component.
FluentBadge.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentBadge.IconEnd: Gets or sets the `Icon` displayed at the end of badge content.
FluentBadge.IconLabel: Gets or sets the aria-label of the `Icon`.
FluentBadge.IconStart: Gets or sets the `Icon` displayed at the start of badge content.
FluentBadge.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentBadge.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentBadge.OffsetX: Gets or sets how much the badge overlaps the content it wraps on the x-axisOnly applied when `FluentBadge.ChildContent` is not null
FluentBadge.OffsetY: Gets or sets how much the badge overlaps the content it wraps on the y-axisOnly applied when `FluentBadge.ChildContent` is not null
FluentBadge.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentBadge.Positioning: Gets or sets the badge's positioning relative to the `FluentBadge.ChildContent`.The default value is `null`. Internally the component uses AboveEnd as its default value.
FluentBadge.Shape: Gets or sets the shape of the badge.
FluentBadge.Size: Gets or sets the size of the badge.
FluentBadge.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.

CachedServices.GetCachedServiceOrNull(): Get service of type <typeparamref name="T" /> from the [System.IServiceProvider](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/System.IServiceProvider) or null if not found.Keep in mind that this method will cache the service in the component memory for future use.
CachedServices.ServiceProvider: Gets the service provider used for dependency injection. It allows access to registered services.

FluentAnchorButton.Appearance: Gets or sets the visual appearance.The default value is `null`. Internally the component uses `ButtonAppearance.Outline` as its default value.
FluentAnchorButton.BackgroundColor: Gets or sets the background color of this button (overrides the `FluentAnchorButton.Appearance` property).Set the value `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)` to display a transparent button.
FluentAnchorButton.ChildContent: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the component.
FluentAnchorButton.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentAnchorButton.Color: Gets or sets the color of the font (overrides the `FluentAnchorButton.Appearance` property).
FluentAnchorButton.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentAnchorButton.Href: Gets or sets the href of the Anchor.
FluentAnchorButton.HrefLang: Gets or sets the language of the referenced resource.
FluentAnchorButton.IconEnd: Gets or sets the `Icon` displayed at the end of button content.
FluentAnchorButton.IconOnly: Gets or sets if the button only shows an iconCan be used when using `FluentAnchorButton.ChildContent` that renders as an icon
FluentAnchorButton.IconStart: Gets or sets the `Icon` displayed at the start of button content.
FluentAnchorButton.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentAnchorButton.Label: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the button.This can be used as an alternative to specifying the content as a child component of the button.If both are specified, both will be rendered.
FluentAnchorButton.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentAnchorButton.Name: Gets or sets the name of the element.Allows access by name from the associated form.
FluentAnchorButton.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentAnchorButton.ReferrerPolicy: Gets or sets the referrer policy.
FluentAnchorButton.Rel: Gets or sets the rel attribute.
FluentAnchorButton.Shape: Gets or sets the shape of the button.The default value is `null`. Internally the component uses `ButtonShape.Rounded` as its default value.
FluentAnchorButton.Size: Gets or sets the size of the button.The default value is `null`. Internally the component uses `ButtonSize.Medium` as its default value.
FluentAnchorButton.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.
FluentAnchorButton.Target: Gets or sets the target of the Anchor.
FluentAnchorButton.Title: Gets or sets the title of the button.The text usually displayed in a `tooltip` popup when the mouse is over the button.
FluentAnchorButton.Tooltip: Gets or sets the tooltip text (supports HTML tags).This parameter requires the presence of a 'FluentTooltipProvider' in your main/layout page. _This parameter cannot be updated after the component has been rendered._
FluentAnchorButton.Type: Gets or sets the type attribute.

FluentButton.__summary__: The FluentButton component allows users to commit a change or trigger an action via a single click or tap andis often found inside forms, dialogs, drawers (panels) and/or pages.
FluentButton.Appearance: Gets or sets the visual appearance.Default is `null'. Internally the component uses `ButtonAppearance.Default` as default.
FluentButton.AutoFocus: Gets or sets whether the button should be focused when the page is loaded.
FluentButton.BackgroundColor: Gets or sets the background color of this button (overrides the `FluentButton.Appearance` property).Set the value `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0)` to display a transparent button.
FluentButton.ChildContent: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the component.
FluentButton.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentButton.Color: Gets or sets the color of the font (overrides the `FluentButton.Appearance` property).
FluentButton.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentButton.Disabled: Gets or sets the element's disabled state, ensuring it doesn't participate in form submission.
FluentButton.DisabledFocusable: Gets or sets the value indicating the button is focusable.
FluentButton.FormAction: Gets or sets the URL that processes the information submitted by the button.
FluentButton.FormEncType: Gets or sets how to encode the form data that is submitted(if the button is a submit button).
FluentButton.FormId: Gets or sets the id of a form to associate the element to.
FluentButton.FormMethod: Gets or sets the HTTP method used to submit the form(if the button is a submit button).
FluentButton.FormNoValidate: Gets or sets if the form need to be validated when it is submitted(if the button is a submit button).
FluentButton.FormTarget: Gets or sets the author-defined name or standardized, underscore-prefixed keyword indicating where to display the response from submitting the form.Possible values: `_self` | `_blank` | `_parent` | `_top`.
FluentButton.IconEnd: Gets or sets the `Icon` displayed at the end of button content.
FluentButton.IconOnly: Gets or sets if the button only shows an iconCan be used when using `FluentButton.ChildContent` that renders as an icon
FluentButton.IconStart: Gets or sets the `Icon` displayed at the start of button content.
FluentButton.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentButton.Label: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the button.This can be used as an alternative to specifying the content as a child component of the button.If both are specified, both will be rendered.
FluentButton.Loading: Gets or sets whether to display a progress ring and disable the button.
FluentButton.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentButton.Name: Gets or sets the name of the element.Allows access by name from the associated form.
FluentButton.OnClick: Command executed when the user clicks on the button.
FluentButton.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentButton.Required: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the element needs to have a value.
FluentButton.Shape: Gets or sets the shape of the button.Default is `null`. Internally the component uses `ButtonShape.Rounded` as default.
FluentButton.Size: Gets or sets the size of the button.Default is `null`. Internally the component uses `ButtonSize.Medium` as default.
FluentButton.StopPropagation: Gets or sets a way to prevent further propagation of the current event in the capturing and bubbling phases.
FluentButton.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.
FluentButton.Title: Gets or sets the title of the button.The text usually displayed in a `tooltip` popup on mouse hovering or keyboard focus.
FluentButton.Tooltip: Gets or sets the tooltip text (supports HTML tags).This parameter requires the presence of a 'FluentTooltipProvider' in your main/layout page. _This parameter cannot be updated after the component has been rendered._
FluentButton.Type: Gets or sets the button type. See `ButtonType` for more details.Default is `null`. Internally the component uses  `ButtonType.Button` as default.
FluentButton.Value: Gets or sets the value associated with the button.This value is passed to the server in params when the form is submitted using this button.

FluentToggleButton.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentToggleButton.Mixed: Gets or sets the mixed state of the component.
FluentToggleButton.Name: Gets or sets the name of the element.Allows access by name from the associated form.
FluentToggleButton.OnClick: Command executed when the user clicks on the button.
FluentToggleButton.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentToggleButton.Pressed: Gets or sets the pressed state of the button.
FluentToggleButton.Required: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the element needs to have a value.
FluentToggleButton.Shape: Gets or sets the shape of the button.Default is `null`. Internally the component uses `ButtonShape.Rounded` as default.
FluentToggleButton.Size: Gets or sets the size of the button.Default is `null`. Internally the component uses `ButtonSize.Medium` as default.
FluentToggleButton.StopPropagation: Gets or sets a way to prevent further propagation of the current event in the capturing and bubbling phases.
FluentToggleButton.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.
FluentToggleButton.Title: Gets or sets the title of the button.The text usually displayed in a `tooltip` popup on mouse hovering or keyboard focus.
FluentToggleButton.Tooltip: Gets or sets the tooltip text (supports HTML tags).This parameter requires the presence of a 'FluentTooltipProvider' in your main/layout page. _This parameter cannot be updated after the component has been rendered._
FluentToggleButton.Type: Gets or sets the button type. See `ButtonType` for more details.Default is `null`. Internally the component uses  `ButtonType.Button` as default.
FluentToggleButton.Value: Gets or sets the value associated with the button.This value is passed to the server in params when the form is submitted using this button.

FluentCard.__summary__: A FluentCard is a container that holds information and actions related to a single concept or object, like a document or a contact.
FluentCard.Appearance: Gets or sets the appearance of the component.
FluentCard.ChildContent: Gets or sets the content of the card.
FluentCard.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentCard.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentCard.Height: Gets or sets the height of the component.
FluentCard.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentCard.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentCard.OnClick: Command executed when the user clicks on the card.
FluentCard.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentCard.Role: Gets or sets the role of the card.
FluentCard.Shadow: Gets or sets the shadow of the component.
FluentCard.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.
FluentCard.Width: Gets or sets the width of the component.

FluentCheckbox.__summary__: The FluentCheckbox component is used to render a checkbox input
FluentCheckbox.AriaLabel: Gets or sets the text used on `aria-label` attribute.
FluentCheckbox.Autofocus: Determines if the element should receive document focus on page load.
FluentCheckbox.CheckState: Gets or sets the state of the CheckBox: true, false or null.Useful when the mode ThreeState is enable
FluentCheckbox.CheckStateChanged: Action to be called when the CheckBox state changes.
FluentCheckbox.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentCheckbox.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentCheckbox.Disabled: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form control is disabled and doesn't participate in form submission.
FluentCheckbox.FocusLost: Gets a value indicating whether the input component has already lost the focus.As long as the user has been in this field at least once and has left it, this property remains false.As soon as the user leaves the field, it becomes true.
FluentCheckbox.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentCheckbox.Label: Gets or sets the text to label the input. This is usually displayed just above the input.
FluentCheckbox.LabelPosition: Gets or sets the position of the label relative to the input.
FluentCheckbox.LabelTemplate: Gets or sets the content to label the input component.This is usually displayed just above the input: see `IFluentField.LabelPosition`
FluentCheckbox.LabelWidth: Gets or sets the width of the label.
FluentCheckbox.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentCheckbox.Message: Gets or sets the message to display below the field.
FluentCheckbox.MessageCondition: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the message should be displayed.
FluentCheckbox.MessageIcon: Gets or sets the icon to display next to the message.You can use predefined icons from the `FluentStatus` class.
FluentCheckbox.MessageState: Gets or sets a value that affects the contentof the `IFluentField.Message` and the `IFluentField.MessageIcon`.
FluentCheckbox.MessageTemplate: Gets or sets the template for the message to display below the field.
FluentCheckbox.Name: Gets or sets the name of the element.Allows access by name from the associated form.⚠️ This value needs to be set manually for SSR scenarios to work correctly.
FluentCheckbox.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentCheckbox.ReadOnly: Gets or sets whether the control will be immutable by user interaction.
FluentCheckbox.Required: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the element needs to have a value.
FluentCheckbox.Shape: Gets or sets the shape of the checkbox. See `CheckboxShape`The default value is `null`. Internally the component uses CheckboxShape.Square.
FluentCheckbox.ShowIndeterminate: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the user can display the indeterminate state by clicking the CheckBox. _If this is not the case, the checkbox can be started in the indeterminate state, but the user cannot activate it with the mouse._
FluentCheckbox.Size: Gets or sets the size of the checkbox. See `CheckboxSize`The default value is `null`. Internally the component uses CheckboxSize.Medium.
FluentCheckbox.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.
FluentCheckbox.ThreeState: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the CheckBox will allow three check states rather than two.
FluentCheckbox.ThreeStateOrderUncheckToIntermediate: Gets or sets a value indicating the order of the three states of the CheckBox.False(by default), the order is Unchecked -> Checked -> Intermediate.True: the order is Unchecked -> Intermediate -> Checked.
FluentCheckbox.Tooltip: Gets or sets the tooltip text (supports HTML tags).This parameter requires the presence of a 'FluentTooltipProvider' in your main/layout page. _This parameter cannot be updated after the component has been rendered._

FluentCounterBadge.__summary__: The FluentCounterBadge component is a visual indicator that communicates a value about an associated component.It uses short postive numbers, color, and icons for quick recognition and is placed near the relavant content.
FluentCounterBadge.Appearance: Gets or sets the visual appearance.
FluentCounterBadge.BackgroundColor: Gets or sets the background color.Must be a valid CSS color value.When using BackgroundColor, `FluentBadge.Color` must be explicitly set to null
FluentCounterBadge.ChildContent: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the component.
FluentCounterBadge.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentCounterBadge.Content: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the component.
FluentCounterBadge.Count: Gets or sets the badge's count.The default value is `null`. Internally the component uses 0 as its default value.With ShowZero being false by default, the default result will be an empty counter badge
FluentCounterBadge.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentCounterBadge.Dot: Gets or sets the badge's dot state.
FluentCounterBadge.IconEnd: Gets or sets the `Icon` displayed at the end of badge content.
FluentCounterBadge.IconLabel: Gets or sets the aria-label of the `Icon`.
FluentCounterBadge.IconStart: Gets or sets the `Icon` displayed at the start of badge content.
FluentCounterBadge.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentCounterBadge.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentCounterBadge.OffsetX: Gets or sets how much the badge overlaps the content it wraps on the x-axisOnly applied when `FluentBadge.ChildContent` is not null
FluentCounterBadge.OffsetY: Gets or sets how much the badge overlaps the content it wraps on the y-axisOnly applied when `FluentBadge.ChildContent` is not null
FluentCounterBadge.OverflowCount: Gets or sets the badge's overflow count.The default value is `null`. Internally the component uses 99 as its default value.
FluentCounterBadge.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentCounterBadge.Positioning: Gets or sets the badge's positioning relative to the `FluentBadge.ChildContent`.The default value is `null`. Internally the component uses AboveEnd as its default value.
FluentCounterBadge.Shape: Gets or sets the shape of the badge.
FluentCounterBadge.ShowWhen: Gets or sets if the badge displays the count based on the specified lambda expression.By default the badge only shows a count when it's greater than 0.For example, to show the count on the badge when the count greater than 4, use ShowWhen=@(Count => Count > 4)
FluentCounterBadge.ShowZero: Gets or sets the badge's show-zero state.
FluentCounterBadge.Size: Gets or sets the size of the badge.
FluentCounterBadge.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.

PropertyColumn`2.__summary__: Represents a `FluentDataGrid` column whose cells display a single value.
PropertyColumn`2.Align: If specified, controls the justification of header and grid cells for this column.
PropertyColumn`2.Class: Gets or sets the an optional CSS class name.If specified, this is included in the class attribute of header and grid cellsfor this column.
PropertyColumn`2.ColumnOptions: If specified, indicates that this column has this associated options UI. A button to display thisUI will be included in the header cell by default.            If `ColumnBase.HeaderCellItemTemplate` is used, it is left up to that template to render any relevant"show options" UI and invoke the grid's <see cref="M:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.FluentDataGrid.ShowColumnOptionsAsync(Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.ColumnBase{`0})" />).
PropertyColumn`2.Comparer: Optionally specifies how to compare values in this column when sorting.            Using this requires the <typeparamref name="TProp" /> type to implement [System.IComparable](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/System.IComparable).
PropertyColumn`2.Filtered: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data is currently filtered by this column.            The default value is false.
PropertyColumn`2.Format: Optionally specifies a format string for the value.            Using this requires the <typeparamref name="TProp" /> type to implement [System.IFormattable](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/System.IFormattable).
PropertyColumn`2.HeaderCellItemTemplate: Gets or sets an optional template for this column's header cell.If not specified, the default header template includes the `ColumnBase.Title` along with any applicable sort indicators and options buttons.
PropertyColumn`2.HeaderCellTitleTemplate: Gets or sets a template for the title content of this column's header cell.If not specified, the default header template includes the `ColumnBase.Title`.
PropertyColumn`2.HeaderTooltip: Gets or sets the tooltip text for the column header.
PropertyColumn`2.Index: Gets or sets the index (1-based) of the column
PropertyColumn`2.InitialSortDirection: Gets or sets the initial sort direction.if `ColumnBase.IsDefaultSortColumn` is true.
PropertyColumn`2.IsDefaultSortColumn: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this column should be sorted by default.
PropertyColumn`2.MinWidth: Gets or sets the minimal width of the column.Defaults to 100px for a regular column and 50px for a select column.When resizing a column, the user will not be able to make it smaller than this value.Needs to be a valid CSS width value like '100px', '10%' or '0.5fr'.
PropertyColumn`2.PlaceholderTemplate: If specified, virtualized grids will use this template to render cells whose data has not yet been loaded.
PropertyColumn`2.Property: Defines the value to be displayed in this column's cells.
PropertyColumn`2.PropertyInfo: Gets the property info for the property this column binds to.
PropertyColumn`2.Sortable: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data should be sortable by this column.            The default value may vary according to the column type (for example, a `TemplateColumn`or `PropertyColumn`2` is sortable by default if any`TemplateColumn.SortBy`or `PropertyColumn`2.SortBy` parameter is specified).
PropertyColumn`2.SortBy: Gets or sets the sorting behavior for this column.
PropertyColumn`2.Style: Gets or sets an optional CSS style specification.If specified, this is included in the style attribute of header and grid cellsfor this column.
PropertyColumn`2.Title: Gets or sets the title text for the column.This is rendered automatically if `ColumnBase.HeaderCellItemTemplate` is not used.
PropertyColumn`2.Tooltip: If true, generates a title and aria-label attribute for the cell contents
PropertyColumn`2.TooltipText: Gets or sets the function that defines the value to be used as the tooltip and aria-label in this column's cells
PropertyColumn`2.Width: Gets or sets the width of the column.Use either this or the `FluentDataGrid` GridTemplateColumns parameter but not both.Needs to be a valid CSS width value like '100px', '10%' or '0.5fr'.

SelectColumn`1.Comparer: Gets or sets the equality comparer used to determine whether two grid items are equal. _If not set, the default equality comparer for <typeparamref name="TGridItem" /> is used.            Setting this property allows customization of how grid items are compared for equality, which can affect_
SelectColumn`1.Filtered: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data is currently filtered by this column.            The default value is false.

SelectColumn`1.HeaderCellTitleTemplate: Gets or sets a template for the title content of this column's header cell.If not specified, the default header template includes the `ColumnBase.Title`.
SelectColumn`1.HeaderTooltip: Gets or sets the tooltip text for the column header.
SelectColumn`1.IconChecked: Gets or sets the Icon to be rendered when the row is selected.
SelectColumn`1.IconIndeterminate: Gets or sets the Icon to be rendered when some but not all rows are selected.Only when `SelectColumn.SelectMode` is Multiple.
SelectColumn`1.IconUnchecked: Gets or sets the Icon to be rendered when the row is non selected.
SelectColumn`1.Index: Gets or sets the index (1-based) of the column
SelectColumn`1.InitialSortDirection: Gets or sets the initial sort direction.if `ColumnBase.IsDefaultSortColumn` is true.
SelectColumn`1.IsDefaultSortColumn: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this column should be sorted by default.
SelectColumn`1.MinWidth: Gets or sets the minimal width of the column.Defaults to 100px for a regular column and 50px for a select column.When resizing a column, the user will not be able to make it smaller than this value.Needs to be a valid CSS width value like '100px', '10%' or '0.5fr'.
SelectColumn`1.OnSelect: Gets or sets the action to be executed when the row is selected or unselected.This action is required to update you data model.
SelectColumn`1.PlaceholderTemplate: If specified, virtualized grids will use this template to render cells whose data has not yet been loaded.
SelectColumn`1.Property: Gets or sets the function to executed to determine checked/unchecked status.
SelectColumn`1.Selectable: Gets or sets the function executed to determine if the item can be selected.
SelectColumn`1.SelectAll: Gets or sets the value indicating whether the [All] checkbox is selected.Null is undefined.
SelectColumn`1.SelectAllChanged: Gets or sets the action to be executed when the [All] checkbox is clicked.When this action is defined, the [All] checkbox is displayed.This action is required to update you data model.
SelectColumn`1.SelectAllDisabled: Gets or sets whether the [All] checkbox is disabled (not clickable).
SelectColumn`1.SelectAllTemplate: Gets or sets the template for the [All] checkbox column template.
SelectColumn`1.SelectedItems: Gets or sets the list of selected items.
SelectColumn`1.SelectedItemsChanged: Gets or sets a callback when list of selected items changed.
SelectColumn`1.SelectFromEntireRow: Gets or sets whether the selection of rows is restricted to the SelectColumn (false) or if the whole row can be clicked to toggled the selection (true).Default is True.
SelectColumn`1.SelectMode: Gets or sets the selection mode (Single, SingleSticky or Multiple).
SelectColumn`1.Sortable: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the data should be sortable by this column.            The default value may vary according to the column type (for example, a `TemplateColumn`or `PropertyColumn`2` is sortable by default if any`TemplateColumn.SortBy`or `PropertyColumn`2.SortBy` parameter is specified).
SelectColumn`1.Style: Gets or sets an optional CSS style specification.If specified, this is included in the style attribute of header and grid cellsfor this column.
SelectColumn`1.Title: Gets or sets the title text for the column.This is rendered automatically if `ColumnBase.HeaderCellItemTemplate` is not used.
SelectColumn`1.TitleAllChecked: Gets or sets the Icon title display as a tooltip and used with Accessibility.The default text is "All rows are selected.".
SelectColumn`1.TitleAllIndeterminate: Gets or sets the Icon title display as a tooltip and used with Accessibility.The default text is "Some rows are selected.".
SelectColumn`1.TitleAllUnchecked: Gets or sets the Icon title display as a tooltip and used with Accessibility.The default text is "No rows are selected.".
SelectColumn`1.TitleChecked: Gets or sets the Icon title display as a tooltip and used with Accessibility.The default text is "Row selected".
SelectColumn`1.TitleUnchecked: Gets or sets the Icon title display as a tooltip and used with Accessibility.The default text is "Row unselected".
SelectColumn`1.Tooltip: If true, generates a title and aria-label attribute for the cell contents
SelectColumn`1.TooltipText: Gets or sets the function that defines the value to be used as the tooltip and aria-label in this column's cells
SelectColumn`1.Width: Gets or sets the width of the column.Use either this or the `FluentDataGrid` GridTemplateColumns parameter but not both.Needs to be a valid CSS width value like '100px', '10%' or '0.5fr'.

SelectAllTemplateArgs.__summary__: Represents the arguments for selecting all items in a template.

FluentDataGrid`1.__summary__: A component that displays a grid.
FluentDataGrid`1.AutoFit: Sets `FluentDataGrid.GridTemplateColumns` to automatically fit the columns to the available width as best it can.
FluentDataGrid`1.AutoFocus: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grids' first cell should be focused.
FluentDataGrid`1.AutoItemsPerPage: Automatically fit the number of items per page to the available height.
FluentDataGrid`1.ChildContent: Gets or sets the child components of this instance. For example, you may define columns by addingcomponents derived from the `ColumnBase` base class.
FluentDataGrid`1.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentDataGrid`1.CloseColumnOptionsAsync(): Closes the `ColumnBase.ColumnOptions` UI that was previously displayed.
FluentDataGrid`1.CloseColumnResizeAsync(): Closes the column resize UI that was previously displayed.
FluentDataGrid`1.ColumnOptionsUISettings: Settings (icon, icon position) used in the column options UI.(aria) labels are controlled through `IFluentLocalizer`
FluentDataGrid`1.ColumnResizeUISettings: Settings (icon, icon position) used in the column resize UI.(aria) labels are controlled through `IFluentLocalizer`
FluentDataGrid`1.ColumnSortUISettings: Settings (icon, icon position) used in the column sorting UI.(aria) labels are controlled through `IFluentLocalizer`
FluentDataGrid`1.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentDataGrid`1.DisplayMode: Gets or set the `DataGridDisplayMode` of the grid.Default is 'Grid'.When set to Grid, `FluentDataGrid.GridTemplateColumns` can be used to specify column widths.When set to Table, widths need to be specified at the column level.When using `FluentDataGrid.Virtualize`, it is recommended to use Table.
FluentDataGrid`1.EmptyContent: If specified, grids render this fragment when there is no content.
FluentDataGrid`1.ErrorContent: Gets or sets the content to render when an error occurs.
FluentDataGrid`1.GenerateHeader: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid should automatically generate a header row and its type.See `DataGridGeneratedHeaderType`
FluentDataGrid`1.GridTemplateColumns: Gets or sets the value that gets applied to the css gridTemplateColumns attribute of child rows.Can be specified here or on the column level with the Width parameter but not both.Needs to be a valid CSS string of space-separated values, such as "auto 1fr 2fr 100px".
FluentDataGrid`1.HandleLoadingError: Gets or sets a delegate that determines whether a given exception should be handled.
FluentDataGrid`1.HeaderCellAsButtonWithMenu: If true, enables the new style of header cell that includes a button to display all column options through a menu.
FluentDataGrid`1.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentDataGrid`1.IsFixed: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid's dataset is not expected to change during its lifetime.When set to true, reduces automatic refresh checks for better performance with static datasets.Default is false to maintain backward compatibility.
FluentDataGrid`1.ItemKey: Optionally defines a value for @key on each rendered row. Typically this should be used to specify aunique identifier, such as a primary key value, for each data item.            This allows the grid to preserve the association between row elements and data items based on theirunique identifiers, even when the <typeparamref name="TGridItem" /> instances are replaced by new copies (forexample, after a new query against the underlying data store).            If not set, the @key will be the <typeparamref name="TGridItem" /> instance itself.
FluentDataGrid`1.Items: Gets or sets a queryable source of data for the grid.            This could be in-memory data converted to queryable using the<see cref="M:System.Linq.Queryable.AsQueryable(System.Collections.IEnumerable)" /> extension method,or an EntityFramework DataSet or an [System.Linq.IQueryable](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/System.Linq.IQueryable) derived from it.            You should supply either `FluentDataGrid.Items` or `FluentDataGrid.ItemsProvider`, but not both.
FluentDataGrid`1.ItemSize: This is applicable only when using `FluentDataGrid.Virtualize`. It defines an expected height in pixels foreach row, allowing the virtualization mechanism to fetch the correct number of items to match the displaysize and to ensure accurate scrolling.
FluentDataGrid`1.ItemsProvider: Gets or sets a callback that supplies data for the rid.            You should supply either `FluentDataGrid.Items` or `FluentDataGrid.ItemsProvider`, but not both.
FluentDataGrid`1.Loading: Gets or sets a value to indicate the grid loading data state.If not set and a `FluentDataGrid.ItemsProvider` is present, the grid will show `FluentDataGrid.LoadingContent` until the provider's first return.
FluentDataGrid`1.LoadingContent: Gets or sets the content to render when `FluentDataGrid.Loading` is true.A default fragment is used if loading content is not specified.
FluentDataGrid`1.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentDataGrid`1.MultiLine: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid should allow multiple lines of text in cells.Cannot be used together with Virtualize.
FluentDataGrid`1.OnCellClick: Gets or sets a callback when a cell is clicked.
FluentDataGrid`1.OnCellFocus: Gets or sets a callback when a row is focused.
FluentDataGrid`1.OnItemsLoading: Gets or sets the callback that is invoked when the asynchronous loading state of items changes and `DataGrid.Infrastructure.IAsyncQueryExecutor` is used. _The callback receives a <see langword="true" /> value when items start loading_
FluentDataGrid`1.OnKeyDownAsync(FluentKeyCodeEventArgs): Checks if key pressed should be handled
FluentDataGrid`1.OnRowClick: Gets or sets a callback when a row is clicked.
FluentDataGrid`1.OnRowDoubleClick: Gets or sets a callback when a row is double-clicked.
FluentDataGrid`1.OnRowFocus: Gets or sets a callback when a row is focused.As of 4.11 a row is a tr element with a 'display: contents'. Browsers can not focus such elements currently, but work is underway to fix that.
FluentDataGrid`1.OverscanCount: This is applicable only when using `FluentDataGrid.Virtualize`. It defines how many additional items will be renderedbefore and after the visible region to reduce rendering frequency during scrolling. While higher values can improvescroll smoothness by rendering more items off-screen, they can also increase initial load times. Finding a balancebased on your data set size and user experience requirements is recommended. The default value is 3.
FluentDataGrid`1.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentDataGrid`1.Pagination: Optionally links this `FluentDataGrid` instance with a `PaginationState` model,causing the grid to fetch and render only the current page of data.            This is normally used in conjunction with a `FluentPaginator` component or some other UI logicthat displays and updates the supplied `PaginationState` instance.
FluentDataGrid`1.RefreshDataAsync(Boolean): Instructs the grid to re-fetch and render the current data from the supplied data source(either `FluentDataGrid.Items` or `FluentDataGrid.ItemsProvider`).
FluentDataGrid`1.RefreshItems: Gets or sets a callback which will be called if there is a change in pagination, ordering or if a RefreshDataAsync is forced.            You must supply `FluentDataGrid.Items` if you use this callback.
FluentDataGrid`1.RemoveSortByColumnAsync(ColumnBase`1): Removes the grid's sort on double click if this is specified <paramref name="column" /> currently sorted on.
FluentDataGrid`1.RemoveSortByColumnAsync(): Removes the grid's sort on double click for the currently sorted column if it's not a default sort column.
FluentDataGrid`1.ResetColumnWidthsAsync(): Resets the column widths to their initial values as specified with the `FluentDataGrid.GridTemplateColumns` parameter.If no value is specified, the default value is "1fr" for each column.
FluentDataGrid`1.ResizableColumns: If true, renders draggable handles around the column headers and adds a button to invoke a resize UI.This allows the user to resize columns manually. Size changes are not persisted.
FluentDataGrid`1.ResizeColumnOnAllRows: Gets or sets a value indicating whether column resize handles should extend the full height of the grid.When true, columns can be resized by dragging from any row. When false, columns can only be resizedby dragging from the column header. Default is true.
FluentDataGrid`1.ResizeType: To comply with WCAG 2.2, a one-click option should be offered to change column widths. We provide such an option through theColumnOptions UI. This parameter allows you to enable or disable this resize UI.Enable it by setting the type of resize to performDiscrete: resize by a 10 pixels at a timeExact: resize to the exact width specified (in pixels)Note: This does not affect resizing by mouse dragging, just the keyboard driven resize.
FluentDataGrid`1.RowClass: Optionally defines a class to be applied to a rendered row.
FluentDataGrid`1.RowSize: Gets or sets the size of each row in the grid based on the `DataGridRowSize` enum.
FluentDataGrid`1.RowStyle: Optionally defines a style to be applied to a rendered row.Do not use to dynamically update a row style after rendering as this will interfere with the script that use this attribute. Use `FluentDataGrid.RowClass` instead.
FluentDataGrid`1.SaveStateInUrl: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid should save its paging state in the URL.<para>This is an experimental feature, which might cause unwanted jumping in the page when you change something in the grid.</para>
FluentDataGrid`1.SaveStatePrefix: Gets or sets a prefix to use when saving the grid state in the URL. _Only relevant when `FluentDataGrid.SaveStateInUrl` is set to <see langword="true" /> on multiple grids on a single page._
FluentDataGrid`1.SetColumnWidthDiscreteAsync(Nullable`1,: Resizes the column width by a discrete amount.
FluentDataGrid`1.SetColumnWidthExactAsync(Int32, Int32): Resizes the column width to the exact width specified (in pixels).
FluentDataGrid`1.SetLoadingState(Nullable`1): Sets the grid's loading state to the specified value.
FluentDataGrid`1.ShowColumnOptionsAsync(ColumnBase`1): Displays the `ColumnBase.ColumnOptions` UI for the specified column, closing any other columnoptions UI that was previously displayed.
FluentDataGrid`1.ShowColumnOptionsAsync(String): Displays the `ColumnBase.ColumnOptions` UI for the specified column <paramref name="title" /> found first,closing any other column options UI that was previously displayed. If the title is not found, nothing happens.
FluentDataGrid`1.ShowColumnOptionsAsync(Int32): Displays the `ColumnBase.ColumnOptions` UI for the specified column <paramref name="index" />,closing any other column options UI that was previously displayed. If the index is out of range, nothing happens.
FluentDataGrid`1.ShowColumnResizeAsync(ColumnBase`1): Displays the column resize UI for the specified column, closing any other columnresize UI that was previously displayed.
FluentDataGrid`1.ShowColumnResizeAsync(String): Displays the column resize UI for the specified column, closing any other columnresize UI that was previously displayed.
FluentDataGrid`1.ShowColumnResizeAsync(Int32): Displays the column resize UI for the specified column, closing any other columnresize UI that was previously displayed.
FluentDataGrid`1.ShowHover: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the grid should show a hover effect on rows.
FluentDataGrid`1.SortByAscending: Indicates whether the grid is currently sorted ascending.
FluentDataGrid`1.SortByColumnAsync(ColumnBase`1, DataGrid: Sets the grid's current sort column to the specified <paramref name="column" />.
FluentDataGrid`1.SortByColumnAsync(String, DataGridSortDi: Sorts the grid by the specified column <paramref name="title" /> found first. If the title is not found, nothing happens.
FluentDataGrid`1.SortByColumnAsync(Int32, DataGridSortDir: Sorts the grid by the specified column <paramref name="index" />. If the index is out of range, nothing happens.
FluentDataGrid`1.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.
FluentDataGrid`1.UseMenuService: Use IMenuService to create the menu, if this service was injected.This value must be defined before the component is rendered (you can't change it during the component lifecycle).Default, true.
FluentDataGrid`1.Virtualize: If true, the grid will be rendered with virtualization. This is normally used in conjunction withscrolling and causes the grid to fetch and render only the data around the current scroll viewport.This can greatly improve the performance when scrolling through large data sets.            If you use `FluentDataGrid.Virtualize`, you should supply a value for `FluentDataGrid.ItemSize` and mustensure that every row renders with the same constant height.            Generally it's preferable not to use `FluentDataGrid.Virtualize` if the amount of data being renderedis small or if you are using pagination.

GridItemsProvider`1.__summary__: A callback that provides data for a `FluentDataGrid`.

GridItemsProviderRequest`1.__summary__: Parameters for data to be supplied by a `FluentDataGrid`'s `FluentDataGrid.ItemsProvider`.
GridItemsProviderRequest`1.ApplySorting(IQueryable`1): Applies the request's sorting rules to the supplied [System.Linq.IQueryable](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/System.Linq.IQueryable).
GridItemsProviderRequest`1.CancellationToken: Gets or sets a token that indicates if the request should be cancelled.
GridItemsProviderRequest`1.Count: If set, the maximum number of items to be supplied. If not set, the maximum number is unlimited.
GridItemsProviderRequest`1.GetSortByProperties(): Produces a collection of (property name, direction) pairs representing the sorting rules.
GridItemsProviderRequest`1.SortByAscending: Gets or sets the current sort direction.            Rather than inferring the sort rules manually, you should normally call either <see cref="M:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.GridItemsProviderRequest.ApplySorting(System.Linq.IQueryable{`0})" />or `GridItemsProviderRequest.GetSortByProperties`, since they also account for `GridItemsProviderRequest.SortByColumn` and `GridItemsProviderRequest.SortByAscending` automatically.
GridItemsProviderRequest`1.SortByColumn: Gets or sets which column represents the sort order.            Rather than inferring the sort rules manually, you should normally call either <see cref="M:Microsoft.FluentUI.AspNetCore.Components.GridItemsProviderRequest.ApplySorting(System.Linq.IQueryable{`0})" />or `GridItemsProviderRequest.GetSortByProperties`, since they also account for `GridItemsProviderRequest.SortByColumn` and `GridItemsProviderRequest.SortByAscending` automatically.
GridItemsProviderRequest`1.StartIndex: Gets or sets the zero-based index of the first item to be supplied.

GridItemsProviderResult`1.__summary__: Holds data being supplied to a `FluentDataGrid`'s `FluentDataGrid.ItemsProvider`.
GridItemsProviderResult`1.Items: Gets or sets the items being supplied.
GridItemsProviderResult`1.TotalItemCount: Gets or sets the total number of items that may be displayed in the grid. This normally means the total number of items in theunderlying data source after applying any filtering that is in effect.            If the grid is paginated, this should include all pages. If the grid is virtualized, this should include the entire scroll range.

FluentCalendar`1.__summary__: Represents a customizable and interactive calendar component that supports various views, date selection modes,and animations for period changes.
FluentCalendar`1.AnimatePeriodChanges: Gets ot sets if the calendar items are animated during a period change.By default, the animation is enabled for Months views, but disabled for Days and Years view.
FluentCalendar`1.AriaLabel: Gets or sets the text used on `aria-label` attribute.
FluentCalendar`1.Autofocus: Determines if the element should receive document focus on page load.
FluentCalendar`1.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentCalendar`1.Culture: Gets or sets the culture of the component.By default [System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/System.Globalization.CultureInfo.CurrentCulture) to display using the OS culture.
FluentCalendar`1.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentCalendar`1.DayFormat: Gets or sets the Type style for the day (numeric or 2-digits).
FluentCalendar`1.DaysTemplate: Defines the appearance of a Day cell.
FluentCalendar`1.Disabled: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the form control is disabled and doesn't participate in form submission.
FluentCalendar`1.DisabledCheckAllDaysOfMonthYear: By default, the `FluentCalendarBase.DisabledDateFunc` check only the first day of the month and the first day of the year for the Month and Year views.Set this property to `true` to check if all days of the month and year are disabled (more time consuming).
FluentCalendar`1.DisabledDateFunc: Function to know if a specific day must be disabled.
FluentCalendar`1.DisabledSelectable: Apply the disabled style to the `FluentCalendarBase.DisabledDateFunc` days.If this is not the case, the days are displayed like the others, but cannot be selected.
FluentCalendar`1.DisplayToday: Gets or sets a value indicating whether today's date should be highlighted in the calendar.
FluentCalendar`1.FocusLost: Gets a value indicating whether the input component has already lost the focus.As long as the user has been in this field at least once and has left it, this property remains false.As soon as the user leaves the field, it becomes true.
FluentCalendar`1.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).

FluentCalendar`1.LabelPosition: Gets or sets the position of the label relative to the input.

FluentCalendar`1.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentCalendar`1.Message: Gets or sets the message to display below the field.
FluentCalendar`1.MessageCondition: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the message should be displayed.
FluentCalendar`1.MessageIcon: Gets or sets the icon to display next to the message.You can use predefined icons from the `FluentStatus` class.
FluentCalendar`1.MessageState: Gets or sets a value that affects the contentof the `IFluentField.Message` and the `IFluentField.MessageIcon`.
FluentCalendar`1.MessageTemplate: Gets or sets the template for the message to display below the field.
FluentCalendar`1.Name: Gets or sets the name of the element.Allows access by name from the associated form.⚠️ This value needs to be set manually for SSR scenarios to work correctly.
FluentCalendar`1.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentCalendar`1.PickerMonth: Gets or sets the current month of the date picker (two-way bindable).This changes when the user browses through the calendar.The month is represented as a TValue which is always the first day of that month.You can also set this to determine which month is displayed first.If not set, the current month is displayed.
FluentCalendar`1.PickerMonthChanged: Fired when the display month changes.
FluentCalendar`1.ReadOnly: Gets or sets whether the control will be immutable by user interaction.
FluentCalendar`1.Required: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the element needs to have a value.
FluentCalendar`1.SelectDatesHover: Fired when the selected mouse over change, to display the future range of dates.

FluentCalendar`1.SelectedDatesChanged: Fired when the selected dates change.
FluentCalendar`1.SelectMode: Gets or sets the way the user can select one or more dates
FluentCalendar`1.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.
FluentCalendar`1.View: Defines the appearance of the `FluentCalendar` component.

InputFileInstance.AnchorId: Gets the identifier of the anchor element.
InputFileInstance.Id: Gets the identifier of the input file instance.

InputFileOptions.__summary__: Represents configuration options for handling file input and upload functionality.
InputFileOptions.Accept: Gets or sets the filter for what file types the user can pick from the file input dialog box.Example: ".gif, .jpg, .png, .doc", "audio/*", "video/*", "image/*"See [https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/accept](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/accept)for more information.
InputFileOptions.BufferSize: Gets or sets the sze of buffer to read bytes from uploaded file (in bytes).Default value is 10 KiB.
InputFileOptions.MaximumFileCount: To select multiple files, set the maximum number of files allowed to be uploaded.Default value is 10.
InputFileOptions.MaximumFileSize: Gets or sets the maximum size of a file to be uploaded (in bytes).Default value is 10 MiB.
InputFileOptions.Mode: Gets or sets the type of file reading.For SaveToTemporaryFolder, use `FluentInputFileEventArgs.LocalFile` to retrieve the file.For Buffer, use `FluentInputFileEventArgs.Buffer` to retrieve bytes.For Stream, use `FluentInputFileEventArgs.Stream` to have full control over retrieving the file.
InputFileOptions.Multiple: To enable multiple file selection and upload, set the Multiple property to true.Set `IInputFileOptions.MaximumFileCount` to change the number of allowed files.
InputFileOptions.OnFileErrorAsync: Raise when a file raised an error.
InputFileOptions.OnFileUploadedAsync: Raise when a file is completely uploaded.
InputFileOptions.OnProgressChangeAsync: Raise when a progression step is updated.

DialogOptions.Alignment: Gets or sets the dialog alignment (by default, the dialog is centered).
DialogOptions.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names.If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the `fluent-dialog` or `fluent-drawer` element.To apply you styles to the `dialog` element, you need to create a class like `my-class::part(dialog) { ... }`
DialogOptions.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
DialogOptions.Footer: Gets the footer actions of the dialog.
DialogOptions.Header: Gets the header title of the dialog.
DialogOptions.Height: Gets or sets the height of the dialog. Must be a valid CSS height value like '600px' or '3em'Only used if Alignment is set to `DialogAlignment.Default`.
DialogOptions.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier of the Dialog element.
DialogOptions.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
DialogOptions.Modal: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this dialog is displayed modally.By default, the dialog is displayed modally (Modal = true). _When a dialog is displayed modally, no input (keyboard or mouse click) can occur except to objects on the modal dialog.The program must hide or close a modal dialog (usually in response to some user action) before input to another dialog can occur._
DialogOptions.OnStateChange: Gets or sets the action raised when the dialog is opened or closed.
DialogOptions.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
DialogOptions.Parameters: Gets a list of dialog parameters.Each parameter must correspond to a `[Parameter]` property defined in the component.
DialogOptions.Size: Gets or sets the default size of the dialog.This value is overridden by `DialogOptions.Width` or `DialogOptions.Height`.
DialogOptions.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles.If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the `dialog` element.
DialogOptions.Width: Gets or sets the width of the dialog. Must be a valid CSS width value like '600px' or '3em'

DialogOptionsFooter.__summary__: Options for configuring a dialog footer.
DialogOptionsFooter.PrimaryAction: Gets or sets the primary action for the footer.
DialogOptionsFooter.PrimaryFirst: Gets or sets whether the primary action is displayed first.
DialogOptionsFooter.SecondaryAction: Gets or sets the secondary action for the footer.

DialogOptionsFooterAction.__summary__: Options for configuring a dialog footer action button.
DialogOptionsFooterAction.Disabled: Gets or sets whether the action button is disabled.
DialogOptionsFooterAction.Label: Gets or sets the label of the action button.By default, this label is not set. So the button will not be displayed.
DialogOptionsFooterAction.OnClickAsync: Gets or sets the action to be performed when the action button is clicked.
DialogOptionsFooterAction.ShortCut: Gets or sets the shortcut key for the action button.By default, "Enter" for the primary action and "Escape" for the secondary action. _The shortcut key is a combination of one or more keys separated by a plus sign.You must use the key names defined in the [Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.Key](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/api/Microsoft.AspNetCore.Components.Web.KeyboardEventArgs.Key) class.You can use the following modifier keys: "Ctrl", "Alt", "Shift", in this order._ Example: `"Enter", "Escape", "Ctrl+Enter", "Ctrl+Alt+Shift+Enter", "Escape;Enter".`
DialogOptionsFooterAction.Visible: Gets or sets whether the action button is visible.

DialogOptionsHeader.__summary__: Options for configuring a dialog header.
DialogOptionsHeader.Title: Gets or sets the title of the dialog.

FluentErrorBoundary.__summary__: Provides a mechanism for handling errors in a fluent manner within a specific context.
FluentErrorBoundary.ChildContent: Gets or sets the content to be rendered inside the component.
FluentErrorBoundary.Class: Gets or sets the CSS class names. If given, these will be included in the class attribute of the component.
FluentErrorBoundary.Data: Gets or sets custom data, to attach any user data object to the component.
FluentErrorBoundary.DisplayErrorDetails: Gets or sets the details to display when an error occurs within the error boundary.
FluentErrorBoundary.ErrorContent: Gets or sets the content to be displayed when there is an error. This content will be rendered in a dialog box.This content will be rendered in place of the default error message when an error occurs within the boundary.
FluentErrorBoundary.ErrorHeader: Gets or sets the content to be rendered as the dialog header for error messages. This content will be rendered in place of the default dialog header when an error occurs within the boundary.
FluentErrorBoundary.HideChildContentOnError: Gets or sets a value indicating whether child content should be hidden when an error occurs.Using False is not recommended, as it may cause performance and security issues:If the detected error is triggered when the content is displayed, there is a risk of an infinite loop.
FluentErrorBoundary.Id: Gets or sets the unique identifier.The value will be used as the HTML [global id attribute](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/HTML/Global_attributes/id).
FluentErrorBoundary.Margin: Gets or sets the component [CSS margin](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/margin) property.
FluentErrorBoundary.MaximumErrorCount: Gets or sets the maximum number of errors that can be handled. If more errors are received,they will be treated as fatal. Calling `FluentErrorBoundary.Recover` resets the count.
FluentErrorBoundary.OnCloseRedirectUrl: Gets or sets the URL to navigate to after an error occurs.
FluentErrorBoundary.Padding: Gets or sets the component [CSS padding](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/CSS/padding) property.
FluentErrorBoundary.Recover(): Resets the error boundary to a non-errored state. If the error boundary is notalready in an errored state, the call has no effect.
FluentErrorBoundary.Style: Gets or sets the in-line styles. If given, these will be included in the style attribute of the component.
FluentErrorBoundary.TitleIcon: Gets or sets the icon displayed in the title bar to indicate an error state.
